The video is corrupted and it messes up VLC.  To watch the second fight, you must quit VLC, and then fast forward to the second fight.  If you just try to fast forward to the second fight, it will be all messed up once you hit the corrupt data right after the first fight.

...as with all the SirPaul releases I've tried to date, this copy is totally unwatchable for the reasons everyone have already stated.  Also, if you plan on converting this file to a different format to overcome its problems, good luck... end result either fails or turns out worse, with audio/video blocking up enough to make anybody in their right mind wait for a properly coded rip.

...and don't just say I need VLC, because that's total crap.  If you tell me the video you rip only works tenuously on a single player with built-in codecs, I'd tell you to figure out how to do it NOT wrong.

Everyone is always complaining about Sir Paul rips (And yeah, this one is missing chunks. But that doesn't usually happen). But at least Sir Paul's stuff will play on Xbox 360. Rudos mp4s will not. And I don't get why Rudos refuses to make their vids playable on Xbox 360. There's in the neighborhood of 70 million of those players out there!
the problem is ur xbox not the video

What do you mean the problem is my Xbox? They all work the same. If what you're saying is that it's Xbox's fault it can't play the file because its support isn't broad enough that's true but that can be said about a lot of things. Sir Paul's files are also fine if you play them on the right player. The reason 360 won't play RUDOS files is because of the way the audio is encoded. A small tweak to the way they're doing the audio and that would be 70 million more players the files would work on.
